title: Quotient space of an algebraic stack
summary: In algebraic geometry, the quotient space of an algebraic stack F, denoted by |F|, is a topological space which as a set is the set of all integral substacks of F and which then is given a "Zariski topology": an open subset has a form | U | âŠ‚ | F | {\displaystyle |U|\subset |F|} for some open substack U of F.[1]
